page.title: 10RELIGION IN NAILSWORTH AREA
page.content: {St.George's }church,Nailsworth, is Church of England.It is rather plain so an artist, Sir Oliver Heywood,is painting a mural at the back of the church.It shows the everyday life in Nailsworth, with{Jesus}in the centre. Above the altar there is a large stained glass window.Before{ {St.George's }was built here in { Nailsworth,there was a church called {Pepperpot}because of its shape. There is a non conformist church{ called{Christchurch.}It has chairs instead of pews.The organ is upstairs and is often hidden by a curtain. There is a Baptist Chapel in Minchinhampton and a Roman Catholic church in{Box.}Opposite the primary school there is an old chapel which is now used as a playschool/youthclub. The{Society of Friends' (Quakers)} meeting house is on Chestnut Hill.
